title: لَام الجُحُود
description: Learn about لام الجحود (Lam of Denial), the lam that follows a negated form of كان and causes the subjunctive mood on the following verb, used to strongly deny capability or intention.

notes.title: What is لام الجحود?
content: لام الجحود (Lam of Denial) is a lam particle that intensifies negation and causes the imperfect verb (المضارع) after it to be in the subjunctive mood (منصوب). It is called لام الجحود because جحود means denial or rejection.
This lam must be preceded by a negated form of كان: either مَا كَانَ (it was not) or لَمْ يَكُنْ (it was not). It expresses emphatic denial of an action.
keyPoints: لام الجحود intensifies negation - strong denial
Must be preceded by مَا كَانَ or لَمْ يَكُنْ
Causes the following verb to be منصوب (subjunctive)
There is an implied أَنْ after the لام

notes.title: The Condition: Negated كان
content: لام الجحود only functions when preceded by كان in a negated form. The negation can be with مَا (ما كان) or with لَمْ (لم يكن). Without this negated كان, the لام is not لام الجحود.
This distinguishes it from لام التعليل (lam of reason/purpose), which can appear in affirmative sentences.
keyPoints: مَا كَانَ + لام الجحود + فعل مضارع منصوب
لَمْ يَكُنْ + لام الجحود + فعل مضارع منصوب
The كان must be complete (تامة) or deficient (ناقصة)
Without negated كان, it becomes لام التعليل instead

examples.english: A scholar would never be ignorant
She would never abandon her duty
We would never disobey the command

notes.title: Quranic Examples of لام الجحود
content: لام الجحود appears frequently in the Quran to emphasize Allah's justice and to deny any wrongdoing on His part or on the part of His prophets. These verses beautifully illustrate the emphatic denial expressed by this construction.
The construction وَمَا كَانَ اللهُ لِـ... (Allah would never...) is particularly common in the Quran.
keyPoints: وَمَا كَانَ اللهُ لِيُعَذِّبَهُمْ وَأَنْتَ فِيهِمْ - Al-Anfal 8:33
وَمَا كَانَ اللهُ لِيُضِلَّ قَوْمًا بَعْدَ إِذْ هَدَاهُمْ - At-Tawbah 9:115
وَمَا كَانَ لِنَفْسٍ أَنْ تَمُوتَ إِلَّا بِإِذْنِ اللهِ - Aal Imran 3:145
مَا كَانَ لِبَشَرٍ أَنْ يُؤْتِيَهُ اللهُ - Aal Imran 3:79

examples.arabic: وَمَا كَانَ اللهُ لِيُعَذِّبَهُمْ وَأَنْتَ فِيهِمْ
examples.english: Allah would not punish them while you are among them (8:33)
Allah would never mislead a people (9:115)
It is not for a prophet to deceive (3:161)

notes.title: Difference: لام الجحود vs لام التعليل
notes.titleArabic: الفرق بين لام الجحود ولام التعليل
content: Both لام الجحود and لام التعليل cause the following verb to be منصوب, but they differ in context and meaning. لام الجحود requires negated كان and expresses denial, while لام التعليل expresses purpose/reason and can appear in any context.
Compare: جِئْتُ لِأَتَعَلَّمَ (I came to learn - لام التعليل) vs مَا كُنْتُ لِأَكْذِبَ (I would never lie - لام الجحود).
keyPoints: لام الجحود: requires مَا كَانَ or لَمْ يَكُنْ, expresses emphatic denial
لام التعليل: can appear anywhere, expresses purpose/reason
Both cause نصب on the following verb
Context determines which لام is being used

examples.english: I came to learn (لام التعليل - purpose)
I did not come to play (لام التعليل - purpose)
I would never play (لام الجحود - denial)
He would never lie (لام الجحود - denial)

exercises.prompt: A scholar would never be ignorant
We would never disobey the command
She would never abandon her duty

exercises.answer: lam of denial / emphatic negation lam
